p: Eco-friendly metal nanoparticles can be produced by certain bacterial isolates that have potent antibacterial and antifungal activity. Mondal et al. [ 6] synthesized silver nanoparticles (AgNPs) extracellularly using an environmental bacterial isolate Citrobacter spp. MS5 culture supernatant. These biosynthesized AgNPs showed effective antibacterial activity against extended spectrum Î²-lactamase (ESBL) producing multidrug resistant Gram-negative bacteria. The AgNPs were reported to exhibit high antifungal activity towards pathogenic Candida spp.
